{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3160118,"name":"Noah Kirby","username":"nonokirby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/9de053/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-08T17:32:47.081Z","cooked":"

team 7470 using rio 2.0 with ds 22.0 navx 1 installed intitialy, upgraded to navx 2 on first rio swap. java command based programming with all ctre hardware (no rev electronics)

at pch albany 2023, our team was experiences bizarre behavior from an unknow failure point. the behavior first occoured when we switched from our main laptop (used for inspection) which was running ds 22.0 to our secondary laptop running ds 23.0. shortly before this, we discovered a bad battery was causing all of the self resetting breakers to trip constatntly. initially, we thought the problem was with the firmware on the rio. we tried swapping the robo rio 2.0 for our robo rio 1.0, which fixed the issue. our first instict was to reflash the sd card, which we got help doing from the Commodores (6919), our robot continued without issue for a few hours until we began having issues with the axis on the joystick not moving the drivetrain. it was now that i looked at the driverstation version and noticed it was outdated. i immideately updated it to 23.1 and the issue went away. we had no further issues until the next day of competition. because the rio 2.0 was sucessfully flashed, we decided to swap it out after testing it on an old electrical panel and seeing it function as intended. upon swapping it out, we had no trouble in pit and during our final 2 qualifying matches. however, when we went to the practice field after alliance selection to attempt to balance 3 robots at once, we could not move, with the same symptoms as before.
we tried
rebooting the computers,
redeploying code,
restarting ds,
resetting the rio,
rebooting the robot,
and hooking into the rio over ethernet directly instead of through the router.

none of it worked.
we finally swapped back to the rio 1.0, tested it, and it moved, but due to outdated code, it wasnt moving properly. we redeployed the code, and it stopped working again. we then swapped back to our main programming laptop with ds 22.0 and it worked again. we left it as is for the rest of the comp and i am now trying to find out what caused this bizarre behavior.
it may be worth noting that the robo rio’s connection was dropping around 40 times per minute when viewing the logs and we were constatantly having trouble obtaining a connection to the rio/router.
any help is apreciated, as we cannot have this happen during a competition again.

You never actually explain what the bizarre behavior is? I also suggest reformatting your questions are it’s quite difficult to read.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-08T17:42:23.780Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Dalton Smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29225,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Docs Maintainer"},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Docs Maintainer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3160232,"name":"Tom Line","username":"Tom_Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-08T19:41:53.878Z","cooked":"
nonokirby:

team 7470 using rio 2.0 with ds 22.0 navx 1 installed intitialy, upgraded to navx 2 on first rio swap. java command based programming with all ctre hardware (no rev electronics)

at pch albany 2023, our team was experiences bizarre behavior from an unknow failure point. the behavior first occoured when we switched from our main laptop (used for inspection) which was running ds 22.0 to our secondary laptop running ds 23.0. shortly before this, we discovered a bad battery was causing all of the self resetting breakers to trip constatntly. initially, we thought the problem was with the firmware on the rio. we tried swapping the robo rio 2.0 for our robo rio 1.0, which fixed the issue. our first instict was to reflash the sd card, which we got help doing from the Commodores (6919), our robot continued without issue for a few hours until we began having issues with the axis on the joystick not moving the drivetrain. it was now that i looked at the driverstation version and noticed it was outdated. i immideately updated it to 23.1 and the issue went away. we had no further issues until the next day of competition. because the rio 2.0 was sucessfully flashed, we decided to swap it out after testing it on an old electrical panel and seeing it function as intended. upon swapping it out, we had no trouble in pit and during our final 2 qualifying matches. however, when we went to the practice field after alliance selection to attempt to balance 3 robots at once, we could not move, with the same symptoms as before.
we tried
rebooting the computers,
redeploying code,
restarting ds,
resetting the rio,
rebooting the robot,
and hooking into the rio over ethernet directly instead of through the router.

none of it worked.
we finally swapped back to the rio 1.0, tested it, and it moved, but due to outdated code, it wasnt moving properly. we redeployed the code, and it stopped working again. we then swapped back to our main programming laptop with ds 22.0 and it worked again. we left it as is for the rest of the comp and i am now trying to find out what caused this bizarre behavior.
it may be worth noting that the robo rio’s connection was dropping around 40 times per minute when viewing the logs and we were constatantly having trouble obtaining a connection to the rio/router.
any help is apreciated, as we cannot have this happen during a competition again.

Ok.

First, it seems like you are taking a shotgun approach to fixing things. At a competition, you would be amazed how quickly experienced troubleshooters will show up when you broadcast that “team xxxxx” needs electrical help, they use Java.

Next, a bad battery should not be able to cause breakers to trip. That does not make sense. That sounds like you’ve got a short in your wiring.

Firmware on the rio has nothing to do with breakers tripping. I do not understand why you made the jump to Rio.

Joystick not moving the drive train may have been the driver station bug that was eliminated in the 23.1 FRC tools update.

To me it sounds like you have a couple issues. First, your wiring, second, it sounds like a code problem. The CSAs at the competition should have had some insight as well, since they can see reboots, crashes, etc.

You also might want to post driver station logs from problem matches.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-08T19:41:53.878Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":60.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Tom Line","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 1498"},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/3","custom_user_title":"Team 1498","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3165133,"name":"Noah Kirby","username":"nonokirby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/9de053/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T12:08:37.546Z","cooked":"

thank you.

my assumption with the rio firmware was that it was possible the sd card was over-volted and some bits got flipped or something similar, as i have heard of it happening before (non first situation though)

We were initially running 23.0 on our backup laptop and didn’t realize it, however when we swapped to our computer running 22.0 which we got inspected with (i asked, and they said it was legal) it worked in between matches and during the next match, but in pit after the next match, it stopped working.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-15T12:08:37.546Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Noah Kirby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7841,"username":"Tom_Line","name":"Tom Line","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tom_line/{size}/236809_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53538,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"iRamBots 7470"},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/4","custom_user_title":"iRamBots 7470","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3165152,"name":"Noah Kirby","username":"nonokirby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/9de053/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T12:35:46.814Z","cooked":"

ds 22.0 on ‘main’ laptop (inspectors told me it was legal)
ds 23.0 on ‘backup’ laptop (was not inspected)

breakers tripping repeatedly, swapped battery and it fixed it.

rio wouldn’t connect to DS after breakers (tried everything but usb as we didn’t have drivers)

swapped to rio 1.0, reflashed with 2023 firmware. it worked.

played several matches until lunch

handed off rio 2.0 to a friend from another team to be reflashed with a new card (when inserted to a computer the sd card didn’t show up)

when we got the rio 2 back, i hooked it up to an old electrical panel and we tested it so we wouldn’t risk failure during a match.

the next day, when we arrived, we put the rio 2.0 back on, and went back to matches.

we then swapped DS to the backup computer so we could work on autonomous on our main computer, not realizing it had 23.0

during a match, a failure regarding 23.0 occoured, and we immedately swapped to the main comptuer for DS while we updated the backup with help from the CSA team.

after getting the backup laptop updated to 23.1, we used it for DS

after alliance selection, when we went to the practice field, we could not connect to the rio through any method again. we tried swapping the router with a backup we had programmed, and it still fixed nothing.

we finally swapped back to the rio 1.0, and it worked, but had old code with improperly configured controls.

when we redeployed, only one solenoid was firing, no other input worked.

we swapped from the backup computer to the main computer for DS, it began working again, and we didn’t swap back to anything until we got home the next day.

link to code in case i’m an idiot. https://github.com/nonokirby/irambots-7470-charged-up

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-15T12:48:59.771Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":13.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Noah Kirby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/nonokirby/irambots-7470-charged-up","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - nonokirby/irambots-7470-charged-up","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53538,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"iRamBots 7470"},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/5","custom_user_title":"iRamBots 7470","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3165175,"name":"Waz","username":"Waz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T13:04:09.288Z","cooked":"

The WPILib version in your build.gradle file is down level. Sometimes, the WPILib and rio image have to move together. Off the top of my head, I cannot remember if that was a requirement for any of the changes this year or not. If that is your issue, there should be a relevant message in the log. At any rate, you should try getting the WPILib, rio image and driver station all to the latest versions and retry.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-15T13:04:09.288Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Waz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20488,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3165430,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-15T17:58:39.769Z","cooked":"
Tom_Line:

Next, a bad battery should not be able to cause breakers to trip. That does not make sense. That sounds like you’ve got a short in your wiring.

Or, perhaps a backwards battery? Check all of your batteries very carefully.

I also think you have a collection of presenting symptoms and a list of changes that were made that don’t really line up, and 2nd the advice to get a CSA assist if something like this happens again. It’s easy to get confused by coincidence/correlation/causation, especially when you change multiple things at once and don’t have a lot of data points.

Between competitions, check your electrical construction very carefully. If there’s another team in your area, you might consider asking them to help you run through things. Do all the updates, test things, and then update backup laptops, RIOs, etc. Try to rethink events during the competition and see if there may be explanations that didn’t come up at the time, especially once you have some known problems you have fixed (for certain, as opposed to we changed X and noticed that Y got better/worse – so we suppose that we found the cause).

Good luck at your next event(s)!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-15T17:58:39.769Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":39,"readers_count":38,"score":12.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Allen Nuttle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14283,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3165998,"name":"Noah Kirby","username":"nonokirby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/9de053/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-16T13:30:13.689Z","cooked":"

we definitely were changing way too much at once in the heat of competition. we’re going to a much more well developed team (the ‘big brother’ of PCH district) to use thier field for autonomous and get help with the previous issues some time next week.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-16T13:30:13.689Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":29,"readers_count":28,"score":20.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"Noah Kirby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53538,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"iRamBots 7470"},"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/8","custom_user_title":"iRamBots 7470","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3166168,"name":"BryanLee","username":"BryanLee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bryanlee/{size}/11725_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-16T16:32:59.662Z","cooked":"

I second @nuttle 's comment, double check your battery leads and make sure one (or more) aren’t wired backwards. We had that happen and before we figured it out someone sharpies all over the side “Bad battery CLICKS!” Because it caused all the breakers to trip repeatedly and they thought it was the battery clicking for some reason. I think we managed to fry the PCM with it too, iirc.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-03-16T16:32:59.662Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":22,"readers_count":21,"score":4.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":429419,"topic_slug":"bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds","display_username":"BryanLee","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26492,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/bizarre-behavior-from-robo-rio-ds/429419/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3333839,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2024-03-15T16:33:32.991Z","cooked":"
